bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: James M. Klain earned his Bachelor of Arts in Drama at UCLA in 1943, and although he did not obtain further degrees, continued his studies there in Theater Arts and Education. Klain went on to work at UCLA as the director of the Campus Activities Service Office, directed the renovation of Royce Hall (1982-1984), served as stage manager at such venues as the Royce Hall Auditorium and Pauley Pavilion (1947-), and held positions as charter member and Vice President of the Theater, Film and Television Alumni Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Record Series 671 contains photographs taken and/or collected by James M. Klain on behalf of UCLA's School of Theater, Film, and Television. These black and white and color photographs document such subjects as events held by the School of Theater, Film, and Television; the renovation of Royce Hall in the early 1980's; sculptures and signage around campus; and other campus events. Additionally, files include some promotional materials for UCLA and the School of Theater, Film, and Television.
This is an inactive record series; no additional University records are expected to be added.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes black and white photo of roofing project at UCLA (n.d.), color photos taken at the Steinway Piano Factory in New York (1977), a color photo of United States President Johnson and Mexican President Adolfo Lopez-Mateos landing on campus in a helicopter (taken by Thelner Hoover, 1964), and a color photo and accompanying slide of a wall applique at Schoenberg Hall (n.d.).
